3.author: Epictetus
3.quote: How long are you going to wait before you demand the best for yourself?

8.author: Seneca
8.quote: This is our big mistake: to think we look forward to death. Most of death is already gone. Whatever time has passed is owned by death.

9.author: Seneca
9.quote: No person has the power to have everything they want, but it is in their power not to want what they don’t have, and to cheerfully put to good use what they do have.

18.author: Viktor Frankl
18.quote: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

19.author: Seneca
19.quote: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a man who is alive.

21.author: Epictetus
21.quote: Curb your desire—don’t set your heart on so many things and you will get what you need.

22.author: Epictetus
22.quote: The chief task in life is simply this: to identify and separate matters so that I can say clearly to myself which are externals not under my control, and which have to do with the choices I actually control. Where then do I look for good and evil? Not to uncontrollable externals, but within myself to the choices that are my own…

24.author: Marcus Aurelius
24.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

25.author: Viktor Frankl
25.quote: What man actually needs is not a tensionless state but rather the striving and struggling for some goal worthy of him.

26.author: Marcus Aurelius
26.quote: Choose not to be harmed — and you won’t feel harmed. Don’t feel harmed — and you haven’t been.

29.author: Cato
29.quote: I begin to speak only when I’m certain what I’ll say isn’t better left unsaid.

33.author: Marcus Aurelius
33.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.

38.author: Seneca
38.quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

39.author: Seneca
39.quote: A man who suffers before it is necessary, suffers more than is necessary.

50.author: Marcus Aurelius
50.quote: The best answer to anger is silence.

51.author: Seneca
51.quote: While we wait for life, life passes.

52.author: Marcus Aurelius
52.quote: External things are not the problem. It’s your assessment of them. Which you can erase right now.
